result.execSummary:
The defendant Iesha D Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 20 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
Initial appearance on July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Iesha D Sutton in court.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
